alert.note: Alert for La Plata (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 19 at 12:50PM MDT until May 21 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Colorado... La Plata River at Hesperus affecting La Plata County. .The combination of warm, spring temperatures and potential for periods of rain falling on snowpack upstream will increase runoff. Water levels and flow in the La Plata River may rise rapidly this evening and overnight. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...La Plata River at Hesperus. * WHEN...Until early Sunday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 AM MDT Friday the stage was 4.9 feet. - Forecast...Conditions in the La Plata River can change rapidly due to rain and rain on snow upstream. Slow moving storms forecast today are projected to result in a quick rise in water levels and flow this evening and overnight. Current forecast spike falls between bankfull and flood stage through Saturday morning. Then, water levels are expected to lower and stay below bankfull. - Action stage is 5.0 feet. - Flood stage is 5.5 feet. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
